For a game as fast-paced and intricate as Mortal Kombat 1, the graphics card’s performance is crucial. You can get a sense of what’s needed from your PC in terms of OS, processor, RAM, and storage from MK1’s system requirements and recommended specs. Meanwhile, the September 14, 2023 release’s visual aesthetics, special effects, and fluid character animations demand more than just the bare minimum from a GPU. Refresh rates and resolutions come into play, and having a GPU that can support higher settings ensures no frame drops or stutters during intense combat scenes.
Another consideration is the synergy between the GPU and the rest of your gaming setup. Compatibility with your monitor’s resolution, the potential for overclocking, and thermal management are aspects that shouldn’t be overlooked. For example, if you’ve invested in a high-refresh-rate monitor, you’d want a GPU that can churn out those high frame rates consistently. There is the opportunity to enjoy the NetherRealm Studios release on slightly older PCs – yes, an Nvidia Geforce GTX 1080 Ti will probably do for MK1 – but we believe the above options will give you the best experience.
Is Mortal Kombat 11 CPU or GPU-intensive?
It is GPU intensive, yes. This means that the game heavily relies on your graphics card to render and produce detailed visuals and effects. A powerful GPU will allow for smoother gameplay, higher resolution, and enhanced graphical settings.
